page.title: 04GAMES AT KINGSWOOD SCHOOL
page.content: These are some of the games we play in the school playground: football, netball, skipping, sevens, conkers, piggy-in-the-middle, kiss-chase, dinky cars, hop-scotch, stepping-stones, ABC, ring-a-roses, tag, volleyball and round-the-snail. Some of these games use lines that have been painted on the playground. One of these is ABC: this game uses an alphabet painted on our playground. If you have a coin, you toss it into the air and call "Heads" or "Tails". If you call right you can move on a letter: the first one to Z wins. At playtimes, we practice netball so that we are good when we play matches. We have to throw the ball into the net which is 2.5 metres from the ground. In autumn we play conkers. You play by having a conker on a piece of string and trying to shatter other people's conkers.
